attribute.name: Enable Error Recording
attribute.toolTip: Whether errors are recorded for display in the Development > Errors module.

attribute.name: Show Web Site Login Remember Me
attribute.headerText: This feature does not work with integrated authentication sources (global logins).

attribute.name: Web Site Login Allows Ancestor Admins
attribute.headerText: Whether the web site login authenticates against the master and uber consoles when the user is not found in the web site console.

attribute.name: Web Site Login Lockout Type
attribute.headerText: Session (Default) is the only supported option for non-Centralpoint authentication sources (Global Logins).

attribute.name: Web Site Login Lockout Start Date
attribute.headerText: The member's start date will be set to this number of minutes in the future allowing them to login again after the time passes.

attribute.name: Web Site Login Change Account
attribute.headerText: When enabled an authenticated user will be permitted to log in as a different user without signing out first.

attribute.name: Console Change Notification Interval
attribute.toolTip: The number of seconds between calls to determine whether an open document in a standard module has been changed by another user.

control.listItem: The LogoutUrl provided in the LoginStatus script or the current page will refresh.
The home page of the LogoutAudience provided in the LoginStatus script or the current audience.
The home page of the web site.

attribute.name: User Properties
attribute.toolTip: Upload an XML file containing valid attribute collection XML.
attribute.headerText: Upload an XML file containing valid attribute collection XML. The XML may add to, rename, and reorder the existing properties.

attribute.name: Audience Properties
attribute.toolTip: Upload an XML file containing valid attribute collection XML.
attribute.headerText: Upload an XML file containing valid attribute collection XML. The XML may add to, rename, and reorder the existing properties.

attribute.name: Taxonomy Properties
attribute.toolTip: Upload an XML file containing valid attribute collection XML.
attribute.headerText: Upload an XML file containing valid attribute collection XML. The XML may add to, rename, and reorder the existing properties.

attribute.name: Ecommerce Properties
attribute.toolTip: Upload an XML file containing valid attribute collection XML.
attribute.headerText: Upload an XML file containing valid attribute collection XML. The XML may add to, rename, and reorder the existing properties.

attribute.name: Resource Properties
attribute.toolTip: Upload an XML file containing valid attribute collection XML.
attribute.headerText: Upload an XML file containing valid attribute collection XML. The XML may add to, rename, and reorder the existing properties.

attribute.name: Administrators Console Navigation Default
attribute.headerText: A comma separated list of console navigation item system names which will be selected by default when creating new records in Site Architecture > Administrators. When this property is left empty Configuration, General, and all of their descendants will be selected by default.

attribute.name: Administrators Accessible Audiences Default
attribute.headerText: A comma separated list of audience system names which will be selected by default when creating new records in Site Architecture > Administrators. When this property is left empty All Audiences will be selected by default with both web site (CDA) and Console access. To restrict new administrator access within a specific audience to web site (CDA) only use 'SystemName:1:0' and for Console only use 'SystemName:0:1'.

attribute.name: Resource Audience Filtration
attribute.headerText: This feature causes resource access to be granted only within the selected audiences. If enabled, data and its referenced resources may belong to different audiences causing display issues in the console and CDA.

attribute.name: Search Full Text Function
attribute.headerText: This attribute only applies to full text keyword searches. Excluding the related taxonomy will cause the search to run faster over a large number of records because records where the keyword is only in a related taxonomy item will not be searched. Taxonomy can still be included in the search by using taxonomy selectors or adding taxonomy names to attributes or Keywords of the records themselves. Changing this value will also affect how the rank associated to full text search results is calculated.

attribute.name: Search Results Limit
attribute.headerText: The maximum number of records returned by queries and searches. Increasing this value may cause searches over a large number records to perform poorly.

attribute.name: Search Criteria Recording
attribute.headerText: This property relates to the web site search only and not individual module searches.

attribute.name: Web Site Edit Mode Enabled
attribute.headerText: Selecting Yes will allow web site visitors to enter/exit edit mode by appending em=1/0 to the query string.

attribute.name: Context Menu Enabled
attribute.toolTip: The context menu is display when you right click anywhere in the web site.

attribute.name: Lead Hits Cache Size
attribute.headerText: The number of lead hits stored in memory before they are written to the data store.

attribute.name: Maximum Rating
attribute.toolTip: The maximum number of items used when rating a data document.

attribute.name: Web Site System Name Space Replacement
Title Document Identifier Word Delimiter
attribute.headerText: Select the delimiter used to separate words with the title document identifier.

attribute.name: Title Document Identifier Maximum Length
attribute.headerText: Select the maximum number of characters used with the title document identifier.

attribute.name: Google Maps API Key
attribute.headerText:
Click here for instructions on how to obtain an API key from Google if maps are used on this site. Either enter no domain and a single API key for the entire site or a newline separated list of API keys per domain as follows.
http://www.domain1.com=APIKey1
http://www.domain2.com=APIKey2

attribute.name: Sync Exclusions
attribute.headerText: Enter a comma (no space) separated list of root relative paths to custom files or folders that should be excluded from the sync. Do not exclude system (non-custom) files from the sync. It is recommended that you prefix your custom files or folders whenever possible to ensure that Centralpoint does not need to sync a file or folder with the same name in the future.

attribute.name: Application Start Method
attribute.headerText: Enter an Assembly, Type, and Method to be dynamically executed when the web site application starts. The Method must be static and take no parameters.

attribute.name: File Explorer Open Files on Double-Click
File Explorer Enable Paging For The Grid
File Explorer Enable Filter Text Box
Account Creation URL
attribute.headerText: Enter URL to the user account creation form. cpsys_Audience constant is supported.

attribute.name: Website Password Expiration
attribute.headerText: If enabled the Scheduled task 'Expire Users Password' must be setup in the master console.

attribute.name: Table Records Cache Limit
attribute.headerText: If values of the specific field are grater then this limit those values will not be inserted into the cache.

attribute.name: Attributes Exclusions
attribute.headerText: Enter a comma (no space) separated list of Attributes that should be excluded from the filter. For attributes in Properties prefix with (Props_). For attributes in Personalization prefix with (Person_). For attributes in Configuration prefix with (Config_)

attribute.name: Stats > Clicks
attribute.headerText: This property will let you configure how the Clicks.aspx page will handle requests.

attribute.name: Domains
attribute.headerText: Please use a comma separated list of domains that will be allowed to hit the Clicks.aspx page. Please add these search engines to this textarea and others if you need to: www.google.com,www.search.aol.com,www.yahoo.com,www.bing.com,www.ask.com

attribute.name: Centralpoint Content Services
attribute.headerText: This would enable or disable Centralpoint Content Services. In order to enable WCF on Windows Server 2012 please check folowing article.

attribute.name: Security
attribute.headerText: To view Centralpoint Content service click here.

attribute.name: Header Elements
attribute.toolTip: HTML elements that will be added to the page header exactly as they are entered here.
attribute.headerText: Link custom JavaScript and CSS files or add meta tags to the HTML header. JavaScript includes should be done using the RegisterUnmanagedScriptInclude CpScript to ensure that they register after the system's client script includes.

attribute.name: Enable Content Delivery Network
attribute.headerText: Utilize the Microsoft Ajax Content Delivery Network when possible.

attribute.name: jQuery & jQuery UI Versions
attribute.headerText: The sync notes will include changes to the versions associated with these options when they occur. It is strongly recommended that you select Stable in a production environment. Legacy is intended for temporary use only while implementing changes to support the Stable version. Beta is intended for use in development and staging environments to test the version which will soon become Stable.

attribute.name: jQuery UI Theme
attribute.headerText: Enter the system name of Design > jQuery UI Themes record with no scope for use on all web site pages.

attribute.name: Register SWF Object JavaScript
attribute.headerText: Register this JavaScript to utilize SWF files uploaded via the RTF editor.

attribute.name: Register CpButton Styles
attribute.headerText: Register the CpButton styles from Private Labeling in the Web Site. These styles will always be registered in consoles.

attribute.name: Styles
attribute.toolTip: CSS styles included on every page.

attribute.name: Scripts
attribute.toolTip: JavaScript included at the top of the page.
attribute.headerText: All mobile devices that identify themselves property

attribute.name: Google Analytics
attribute.headerText: This property will set up Google Analytics on your site. Please visit the module suite Web Statistics to see Google Analytics modules inside Centralpoint. Please get in contact with your production staff member in order to get these turned on if they are not available to you.

attribute.name: Google Analytics Account Id
attribute.headerText: This is the found in Admin > Property Settings of Google Analytics. It should look like this: UA-########-#

attribute.name: Custom Dimensions
attribute.headerText:
Please select if you are going to use custom dimensions. Please visit Creating and editing custom dimensions and metrics for instructions on how to create them.
It is advised by Google not to change your dimensions once they have been determined, because the data will be mis-matched.

attribute.name: Custom Dimension 1
attribute.headerText: Please select which Centralpoint property to add to your dimension.

attribute.name: Google Analytics Custom Scripts
attribute.toolTip: JavaScript included at the top of the page.
attribute.headerText: These scripts will go into the HEAD of the HTML page.

attribute.name: Startup Scripts
attribute.toolTip: JavaScript included in the page footer.
attribute.headerText: Startup scripts should not include open and close HTML SCRIPT elements.

attribute.name: Console Startup Scripts
attribute.headerText: Startup scripts should not include open and close HTML SCRIPT elements.

attribute.name: Footer Elements
attribute.toolTip: HTML elements that will be added to the page footer exactly as they are entered here.
